Description: Fragment of foot and wall of an East Greek pottery plate or shallow bowl. Glaze band at base of wall outside. Inside, ornamental friezes divided by broad bands with traces of added colour: rays or the like central, triglyphs and stars(?) outside and rosette at preserved edge. .
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.514)
